intro: Arrojadoa albicoronata, commonly known as the white-capped arrojadoa, is a rare flowering plant native to the Andes Mountains of South America. It is characterized by its striking white petals with a subtle yellow center, which give it its common name. The plant typically grows in high-altitude regions, where it thrives in cool, moist environments. Its leaves are narrow and elongated, often covered in a fine layer of hair to protect against the harsh climate. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a vulnerable species.
